Fundamentals of Network Infrastructure: This milestone would cover the basics of network design and infrastructure, including the role of ISPs in internet connectivity, types of networks (like LAN, WAN), and key network components (routers, switches, servers).

tasks.subject: Data Routing and Bandwidth Management
tasks.description: How Internet Service Providers (ISPs) manage and distribute internet connectivity to users. It involves understanding network infrastructure, data routing, bandwidth allocation, and the interplay between different ISPs.

supportitems.description: Theoretical understanding of how Internet Service Providers (ISPs) manage and distribute internet connectivity to users.

This section would delve into how data is routed through networks, exploring concepts like IP addressing, DNS, and routing protocols. It would also cover bandwidth management and how ISPs allocate resources to ensure efficient data transmission.

tasks.subject: Inter-ISP Collaboration and Future Trends
tasks.description: Focusing on the relationships between different ISPs, peering and transit agreements, and the challenges of network scalability. It would also explore emerging trends and future directions in ISP network technology, such as the impact of 5G and IoT on network management and transition to decentralised, blockchain-powered mobile network World Mobile.

tasks.subject: Pros and Cons of centralized and decentralized ISPs
tasks.description: Centralized ISPs offer reliable, consistent service and efficient maintenance but can lead to monopolies, potentially reducing innovation and customer choice. Decentralized ISPs promote competition and innovation, but might face challenges in providing consistent, widespread coverage and maintaining network infrastructure.
